segments.en: Hello everyone and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine and we're going to the gym today, right Marco?
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们要去健身房，对吧Marco？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we're going to go to the gym and we're going to try to lose weight or to get in shape.
segments.cn: 今天我们要去健身房，尝试减肥或塑形。

segments.en: So, before we start out though, there is a phrasal verb that we should take a look at.
segments.cn: 不过在开始之前，我们应该看看一个短语动词。

segments.en: So today in vocabulary preview we're looking at this phrase, to work out or working out.
segments.cn: 今天在词汇预览中，我们要看这个短语，锻炼或健身。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So when we go to the gym, this is what we do.
segments.cn: 所以当我们去健身房时，这就是我们要做的。

segments.en: We go there to work out.
segments.cn: 我们去那里锻炼。

segments.en: To exercise or to tone up, this is just a way of saying that I'm going to go somewhere like a gym to exercise myself.
segments.cn: 锻炼或塑形，这只是说我会去像健身房这样的地方锻炼自己。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, with that in mind, we're going to go to the gym, we're going to work out, and we're going to learn a lot of words today about what exactly goes on in the gym.
segments.cn: 所以，考虑到这一点，我们要去健身房，锻炼，并且今天会学到很多关于健身房的词汇。

segments.en: Do you want to go catch a movie tonight?
segments.cn: 你今晚想去看电影吗？

segments.en: I can't.
segments.cn: 我不能。

segments.en: I have to go to the gym.
segments.cn: 我得去健身房。

segments.en: Come on.
segments.cn: 来吧。

segments.en: You can go tomorrow.
segments.cn: 你可以明天去。

segments.en: Just skip it today.
segments.cn: 今天就跳过吧。

segments.en: It's not as if you're going to get in trouble.
segments.cn: 你不会因此惹麻烦的。

segments.en: Actually, I will.
segments.cn: 其实，我会。

segments.en: I'm working out with a personal trainer that gets on my case if I don't go.
segments.cn: 我和一个私人教练一起锻炼，如果我不去，他会找我麻烦。

segments.en: I like it because it makes me feel more obligated to go and get healthy.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这样，因为这让我更有义务去锻炼，变得健康。

segments.en: That's cool.
segments.cn: 那很好。

segments.en: Does your personal trainer basically teach you how to work out?
segments.cn: 你的私人教练基本上教你如何锻炼吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: He makes a workout plan depending on the areas I want to work on or the muscles I want to build.
segments.cn: 他会根据我想锻炼的部位或想要增强的肌肉制定锻炼计划。

segments.en: Like, for example, in order to get better muscle tone in my abs, pecs, and biceps, he makes me work out with free weights.
segments.cn: 比如，为了增强我的腹肌、胸肌和肱二头肌的肌肉线条，他让我用哑铃锻炼。

segments.en: Then for my quads, calves, and hamstrings, I do leg lifts or squats.
segments.cn: 然后对于我的大腿前侧、小腿和腿筋，我做腿举或深蹲。

segments.en: Sounds like you're really getting into shape.
segments.cn: 听起来你真的在塑形。

segments.en: Alright, so now we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们回来了。

segments.en: Let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, first of all, in today's dialogue, we heard a lot about this person called a personal trainer.
segments.cn: 首先，在今天的对话中，我们听到了很多关于私人教练的内容。

segments.en: What does a personal trainer do, Marco?
segments.cn: 私人教练的工作是什么，Marco？

segments.en: Basically, you have a person that is your coach, the person that guides you and teaches you how to work out or what you should do.
segments.cn: 基本上，你有一个人是你的教练，指导你并教你如何锻炼或你应该做什么。

segments.en: Alright, so personal means it's just for me.
segments.cn: 好的，所以私人意味着这是专门为我。

segments.en: This person is only helping me.
segments.cn: 这个人只是在帮助我。

segments.en: And a trainer is someone who, like you say, gives me guidance.
segments.cn: 而教练是像你说的，给我指导的人。

segments.en: So a personal trainer is someone who will work with me every day or maybe one time a week to really get the most out of my workout.
segments.cn: 所以私人教练是一个每天或每周一次和我一起锻炼的人，以便充分利用我的锻炼。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So that is a personal trainer.
segments.cn: 所以这就是私人教练。

segments.en: And as we said, he's going to help us to build muscle.
segments.cn: 正如我们所说，他会帮助我们增肌。

segments.en: We want to build muscle when we go to the gym.
segments.cn: 我们去健身房时想要增肌。

segments.en: Alright, so this is an interesting one because the verb is not to grow or to make.
segments.cn: 好的，这个有趣，因为动词不是生长或制造。

segments.en: The verb is to build.
segments.cn: 动词是建立。

segments.en: So I have muscles, but I want my muscles to get bigger, so I go to build muscles at the gym.
segments.cn: 所以我有肌肉，但我想让我的肌肉变大，所以我去健身房增肌。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: You might even hear this phrase, a body builder.
segments.cn: 你甚至可能会听到这个短语，健美运动员。

segments.en: So this idea that you make them.
segments.cn: 所以这个概念是你让它们变大。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: So you don't get muscle, you don't create muscle, you build muscle.
segments.cn: 所以你不是获得肌肉，也不是创造肌肉，而是建立肌肉。

segments.en: And alongside with muscles, not only do you get them big, but you also get muscle tone.
segments.cn: 除了肌肉，你不仅让它们变大，还能获得肌肉线条。

segments.en: Alright, so muscle tone basically means definition.
segments.cn: 好的，所以肌肉线条基本上意味着轮廓。

segments.en: So maybe before you start to work out, your body is very soft.
segments.cn: 所以也许在你开始锻炼之前，你的身体非常柔软。

segments.en: You can't see the muscles.
segments.cn: 你看不到肌肉。

segments.en: Well, when you start to see those muscles, you see the lines in your body, your skin gets tighter, not so soft.
segments.cn: 当你开始看到那些肌肉时，你会看到身体的线条，皮肤变得紧致，不再那么柔软。

segments.en: That's called muscle tone.
segments.cn: 这就是肌肉线条。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So then you can see the muscles.
segments.cn: 所以你可以看到肌肉。

segments.en: That's muscle tone.
segments.cn: 这就是肌肉线条。

segments.en: And now the muscles that we most commonly go to the gym to work out, we're going to name really quickly and we're going to see where they are.
segments.cn: 现在我们最常去健身房锻炼的肌肉，我们将快速命名并看看它们在哪里。

segments.en: So the first one that we mentioned were abs.
segments.cn: 所以我们提到的第一个是腹肌。

segments.en: Okay, this is an important one, especially if you want to go to the beach.
segments.cn: 好的，这个很重要，特别是如果你想去海滩。

segments.en: The abs are located on your stomach.
segments.cn: 腹肌位于你的腹部。

segments.en: So you see those kind of rectangles, those squares on your stomach.
segments.cn: 所以你会看到你腹部上的那些矩形、方形。

segments.en: Those are the abs.
segments.cn: 那些就是腹肌。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And now for guys also, we want to work out our pecs or our pectoral muscles.
segments.cn: 现在对于男生来说，我们也想锻炼我们的胸肌。

segments.en: So those are on your chest, below your neck, but above your stomach.
segments.cn: 所以那些在你的胸部，脖子下方，但在腹部上方。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And another important one on your arm, we have our biceps.
segments.cn: 还有一个重要的在你的手臂上，我们有肱二头肌。

segments.en: Men usually like to show these off, or at least boys do.
segments.cn: 男性通常喜欢展示这些，或者至少男孩是这样。

segments.en: These are on your arms.
segments.cn: 这些在你的手臂上。

segments.en: So you know when you make that L shape with your arm and you squeeze like Popeye?
segments.cn: 所以你知道当你用手臂做L形并像大力水手那样用力时？

segments.en: Those are your biceps.
segments.cn: 那些就是你的肱二头肌。

segments.en: Those are your biceps, exactly.
segments.cn: 那些就是你的肱二头肌，没错。

segments.en: And now obviously going down towards our legs now, we have our quad muscles, our quads.
segments.cn: 现在显然往下到我们的腿，我们有大腿肌肉。

segments.en: Alright, so those are on the top part of your legs, right Marco?
segments.cn: 好的，所以那些在你腿的上部，对吧Marco？

segments.en: In front.
segments.cn: 在前面。

segments.en: In front, so like on the top of your thigh.
segments.cn: 在前面，所以在大腿的顶部。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And now right behind the back part of your leg, you have your hamstrings.
segments.cn: 现在在你腿的后面，你有腿筋。

segments.en: Hamstring.
segments.cn: 腿筋。

segments.en: Now you hear about this one a lot because people injure their hamstrings pretty easily in football or in running.
segments.cn: 现在你经常听到这个，因为人们在足球或跑步时很容易拉伤腿筋。

segments.en: Yeah, that's right.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: Sometimes if you're running and you didn't stretch, your muscles are not warm, you can pull a hamstring.
segments.cn: 有时如果你在跑步而没有拉伸，肌肉没有热身，你可能会拉伤腿筋。

segments.en: Alright, so that hamstring is an important one.
segments.cn: 好的，所以腿筋是一个重要的部位。

segments.en: But we have one more.
segments.cn: 但我们还有一个。

segments.en: That's right, we have our calves.
segments.cn: 没错，我们有小腿。

segments.en: And these are in the bottom, right above our feet.
segments.cn: 这些在底部，正好在脚上方。

segments.en: So I don't have any muscles except for this one because I ride my bike.
segments.cn: 所以我除了这个部位没有其他肌肉，因为我骑自行车。

segments.en: And when you ride your bike, this gets big.
segments.cn: 当你骑自行车时，这个部位会变大。

segments.en: So your calves are that part of your leg above your foot, but below your knee, in the back.
segments.cn: 所以你的小腿是腿上方、膝盖下方、后面的部分。

segments.en: That's right, the back part.
segments.cn: 没错，后面的部分。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So all of these muscles, some of the most common ones that we work out.
segments.cn: 所以所有这些肌肉是我们最常锻炼的一些。

segments.en: So now, let's move on to some important phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们继续一些在流利表达中重要的短语。

segments.en: Do you want to go catch a movie tonight?
segments.cn: 你今晚想去看电影吗？

segments.en: I can't.
segments.cn: 我不能。

segments.en: I have to go to the gym.
segments.cn: 我得去健身房。

segments.en: Come on, you can go tomorrow.
segments.cn: 来吧，你可以明天去。

segments.en: Just skip it today.
segments.cn: 今天就跳过吧。

segments.en: It's not as if you're going to get in trouble.
segments.cn: 你不会因此惹上麻烦。

segments.en: Actually, I will.
segments.cn: 其实，我会。

segments.en: I'm working out with a personal trainer that gets on my case if I don't go.
segments.cn: 我和一个私人教练一起锻炼，如果我不去，他会对我唠叨。

segments.en: I like it because it makes me feel more obligated to go and get healthy.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这样，因为这让我更有责任感去锻炼和保持健康。

segments.en: That's cool.
segments.cn: 这很好。

segments.en: Does your personal trainer basically teach you how to work out?
segments.cn: 你的私人教练基本上教你如何锻炼吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: He makes a workout plan depending on the areas I want to work on, or the muscles I want to build.
segments.cn: 他会根据我想锻炼的部位或想增肌的肌肉制定锻炼计划。

segments.en: Like, for example, in order to get better muscle tone in my abs, pecs, and biceps, he makes me work out with free weights.
segments.cn: 比如，为了增强我的腹肌、胸肌和肱二头肌的肌肉线条，他让我用哑铃锻炼。

segments.en: Then for my quads, calves, and hamstrings, I do leg lifts or squats.
segments.cn: 然后对于我的大腿、小腿和腿筋，我做腿举或深蹲。

segments.en: Sounds like you're really getting into shape.
segments.cn: 听起来你真的在塑形。

segments.en: So at the beginning of the dialogue, the friends were trying to decide what to do.
segments.cn: 所以在对话开始时，朋友们在决定做什么。

segments.en: And one friend said, do you want to go catch a movie?
segments.cn: 其中一个朋友说，你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So, to catch a movie.
segments.cn: 所以，去看电影。

segments.en: Do you want to go catch a movie?
segments.cn: 你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: It sounds funny because, you know, catch means to hold something in your hands after someone throws it.
segments.cn: 听起来有点搞笑，因为你知道，catch意味着在别人扔东西后用手接住。

segments.en: So throw and catch.
segments.cn: 所以扔和接。

segments.en: But here, it doesn't mean to actually hold something in your hands.
segments.cn: 但在这里，它并不意味着真的用手接住什么。

segments.en: It means, do you want to go see a movie?
segments.cn: 它的意思是，你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，正是如此。

segments.en: So it's a very informal, colloquial way of saying, hey, do you want to go to the movies?
segments.cn: 所以这是一种非常非正式、口语化的说法，嘿，你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: Do you want to go see a movie?
segments.cn: 你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: Maybe not like a, yeah, serious date or something, just for fun.
segments.cn: 可能不是那种，嗯，严肃的约会，只是为了好玩。

segments.en: Do you want to go catch a movie?
segments.cn: 你想去看电影吗？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Let's go catch a movie.
segments.cn: 我们去看电影吧。

segments.en: All right, so obviously we can't go to the movies because we got to go to the gym.
segments.cn: 好吧，显然我们不能去看电影，因为我们得去健身房。

segments.en: And we have to go to the gym because our personal trainer will get on our case.
segments.cn: 我们必须去健身房，因为我们的私人教练会对我们唠叨。

segments.en: The personal trainer will get on my case if I don't go.
segments.cn: 如果我不去，私人教练会对我唠叨。

segments.en: All right, so someone will get on my case if I don't do this.
segments.cn: 好吧，如果我不这样做，就会有人对我唠叨。

segments.en: So this is an interesting way of saying, my personal trainer will criticize me or will be angry with me if I don't do this.
segments.cn: 这是一种有趣的说法，我的私人教练会批评我或对我生气，如果我不这样做。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you can use it with, for example, your parents.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用它，比如说你的父母。

segments.en: Your parents are always getting on your case because you don't clean your room.
segments.cn: 你的父母总是对你唠叨，因为你不打扫你的房间。

segments.en: Yeah, my mom gets on my case when I don't tell her where I'm going when I go out.
segments.cn: 是的，我妈妈在我外出时不告诉她我去哪儿时会对我唠叨。

segments.en: So that means to criticize, to give you a hard time, to get angry at you or even maybe yell at you.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着批评、给你带来麻烦、对你生气，甚至可能对你大喊。

segments.en: But you can change the pronoun.
segments.cn: 但你可以换代词。

segments.en: So he gets on my case, but I can get on your case.
segments.cn: 所以他对我唠叨，但我可以对你唠叨。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So just remember that someone gets on someone else's case.
segments.cn: 所以只要记住，有人会对另一个人唠叨。

segments.en: That's where the person goes.
segments.cn: 这就是那个人的去向。

segments.en: And of course, if you want to tell that person to stop bothering you, you just say, get off my case.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你想告诉那个人停止打扰你，你只需说，别对我唠叨。

segments.en: All right, so he's on her case.
segments.cn: 好吧，他在对她唠叨。

segments.en: Get off my case.
segments.cn: 别对我唠叨。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And now to finish things off, the whole reason why we're going to the gym is because we want to get in shape.
segments.cn: 现在结束时，我们去健身房的原因是因为我们想塑形。

segments.en: All right, great phrase here to get in shape.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有个很好的短语，塑形。

segments.en: This is something a lot of people like to do in the new year.
segments.cn: 这是很多人新年时喜欢做的事情。

segments.en: So they say, OK, it's a new year.
segments.cn: 所以他们说，好吧，新的一年。

segments.en: I want a new body.
segments.cn: 我想要一个新身体。

segments.en: I'm going to get in shape.
segments.cn: 我要塑形。

segments.en: That means I will lose weight, build some muscle and start to feel good.
segments.cn: 这意味着我会减肥，增肌，开始感觉良好。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we want to get in shape.
segments.cn: 所以我们想要塑形。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Do you want to go catch a movie tonight?
segments.cn: 你今晚想去看电影吗？

segments.en: I can't.
segments.cn: 我不能。

segments.en: I have to go to the gym.
segments.cn: 我得去健身房。

segments.en: Come on, you can go tomorrow.
segments.cn: 来吧，你可以明天去。

segments.en: Just skip it today.
segments.cn: 今天就跳过吧。

segments.en: It's not as if you're going to get in trouble.
segments.cn: 你不会因此惹上麻烦。

segments.en: Actually, I will.
segments.cn: 其实，我会。

segments.en: I'm working out with a personal trainer that gets on my case if I don't go.
segments.cn: 我和一个私人教练一起锻炼，如果我不去，他会对我唠叨。

segments.en: I like it because it makes me feel more obligated to go and get healthy.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这样，因为这让我更有责任感去锻炼和保持健康。

segments.en: That's cool.
segments.cn: 这很好。

segments.en: Does your personal trainer basically teach you how to work out?
segments.cn: 你的私人教练基本上教你如何锻炼吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: He makes a workout plan depending on the areas I want to work on or the muscles I want to build.
segments.cn: 他会根据我想锻炼的部位或想增肌的肌肉制定锻炼计划。

segments.en: Like, for example, in order to get better muscle tone in my abs, pecs and biceps, he makes me work out with free weights.
segments.cn: 比如，为了增强我的腹肌、胸肌和肱二头肌的肌肉线条，他让我用哑铃锻炼。

segments.en: Then for my quads, calves and hamstrings, I do leg lifts or squats.
segments.cn: 然后对于我的大腿、小腿和腿筋，我做腿举或深蹲。

segments.en: Sounds like you're really getting into shape.
segments.cn: 听起来你真的在塑形。

segments.en: Alright, so going to the gym, getting a personal trainer, what do you think?
segments.cn: 好吧，去健身房，找个私人教练，你觉得怎么样？

segments.en: Is it a good idea or a bad idea?
segments.cn: 这是个好主意还是坏主意？

segments.en: I think for some people who have a hard time getting motivated, so people who don't like to go to the gym, it's a great idea.
segments.cn: 我认为对于一些很难激励自己的人来说，尤其是不喜欢去健身房的人，这是个好主意。

segments.en: Because having another person push you can really help.
segments.cn: 因为有另一个人推动你真的很有帮助。

segments.en: I think for other people who are already pushing themselves, it's not as helpful.
segments.cn: 我认为对于那些已经在努力锻炼的人来说，这并没有那么有帮助。

segments.en: I think also if you just start out going to the gym, I think you should get a personal trainer for the first couple of weeks.
segments.cn: 我认为如果你刚开始去健身房，我认为你应该在最初的几周请一个私人教练。

segments.en: You know, because you really have to understand and learn what you're doing and the purpose of that exercise and figure out how many sets, how many repetitions.
segments.cn: 你知道，因为你真的需要理解和学习你在做什么，以及这个锻炼的目的，弄清楚多少组，多少次重复。

segments.en: All this is very important because some people just go and they overwork it.
segments.cn: 这些都非常重要，因为有些人只是去，他们过度锻炼。

segments.en: They do and they don't know how to use the machines or the weights and you can actually harm yourself.
segments.cn: 他们这样做，但他们不知道如何使用机器或哑铃，实际上可能会伤到自己。

segments.en: You can pull a hamstring or something if you don't know what you're doing.
segments.cn: 如果你不知道自己在做什么，你可能会拉伤腿筋或其他。

segments.en: So for people who've never learned how to exercise, maybe it's a good idea like you say.
segments.cn: 所以对于那些从未学过如何锻炼的人来说，或许就像你说的那样是个好主意。

segments.en: Well, it's a very interesting thing.
segments.cn: 嗯，这是一件非常有趣的事情。

segments.en: Actually, gyms as well, very popular nowadays, especially with the holidays passing.
segments.cn: 其实，健身房现在也非常受欢迎，尤其是在假期过后。

segments.en: You know, people gain some holiday weight.
segments.cn: 你知道，人们在假期期间会增加一些体重。

segments.en: You got to go back to the gym to lose that weight.
segments.cn: 你得回到健身房去减掉那些体重。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So let us know.
segments.cn: 所以告诉我们。

segments.en: Do you go to the gym?
segments.cn: 你去健身房吗？

segments.en: If so, what parts of your body do you like to focus on?
segments.cn: 如果去的话，你喜欢关注身体的哪些部位？

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是 EnglishPod.com.

segments.en: Alright, we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
